issues.title: Don't need "last object in track" parameter?
issues.author: sharmafb
issues.body: We have the parameters "start object", "start group", "last group in track", "objects per group", "group increment", and "object increment" from which we should be able to infer the last object in the track.

comments.author: afrind
comments.body: I guess it could either be {start group + num groups * group increment, objects per group} or {start group + num groups * group increment + 1, 0}.

comments.author: sharmafb
comments.body:
Wouldn't it be neither? The definition in section 2.4 seems to imply that the object ids increase throughout the TRACK, rather than just within a GROUP (it says "This field specifies the starting object number for the TRACK. The default value is 0.").

Assuming the object numbers start at some value and keep increasing throughout the track as per the object increment, wouldn't this be:

(start object) + (num objects in total - 1) * (object increment)

where (num objects in total) can be calculated from "start group", "last group in track", "objects per group", and "group increment"?

pulls.title: Clarification on start object being reset for each group
pulls.author: sharmafb
pulls.body:
Previously, there was some ambiguity as to whether the object ids get reset at the beginning of each group. For example, if start_object == 0 and object_increment == 1 and objects_per_group == 3, there was ambiguity as to whether things would look like:

Group 0: 0, 1, 2
Group 1: 3, 4, 5
...

OR

Group 0: 0, 1, 2
Group 1: 0, 1, 2
...

comments.body:
```suggestion
This field specifies the starting object number for each group in the track.
The default value is 0.
```

pulls.title: Update draft-afrind-moq-test.md with PUBLISH
pulls.author: SUJP123
pulls.body: Added description of how PUBLISH will be added as part of publisher behavior.

comments.body:
```suggestion
Upon receiving a valid SUBSCRIBE or FETCH for a moq-test track, the publisher
MUST publish objects according to the parameters of the namespace.

Upon receiving a SUBSCRIBE_ANNOUNCES with a Track Namespace, the publisher MUST
use PUBLISH to send objects according to the parameters of the namespace. If the
publisher receives a PUBLISH_ERROR, it will stop sending objects immediately.
```
